head.title: A story about everything, from energy density to good old King Arthur
head.meta: A story about everything, from energy density to good old King Arthur

section.p: This is the place where the author typically explains why he or she wanted to write the book. Also a natural place to mention what the reader might expect from the book.
A foreword might very well contain several paragraphs, but this one has only got two.
This is the place to thank your spouse, your dog and your bank manager.

section.h: A little bit of the beginning

p.d:s: As this is only a little bit of the beginning, it can't be too long.
But small as it is, it must be possible to emphasize what you mean, and even use some strong language, if that feels natural.

section.p: And I can't see why a little bit of the beginning can't contain a list, so here it is:

ul.li: This is an important point to state.
But this is the final and most important one!!!

section.p: And that list marks the end of this section.
This is an obvious place to present a table.

tr.th: Some time after the big bang

tr.td: Definitely a higher density than today
A suitable energy density for nurturing life. We don't get fried, and we don't freeze to death.
Hard to say! It probably depends on your religious preferences.
We did get people to the moon, and back again. We did manage to create the DAISY standard. However, solving global warming, global poverty, global economy is still a bit out of reach.

section.p: There is certainly nothing like a good tabular presentation in a leisure book!
Sorry! I couldn't help it. The heading seemed so obvious.

According to must writers, this is the tricky part. The reader is now expecting some action, or at least something more exciting than the beginning. And that will be very difficult in this book, taking into consideration that the beginning of this book aktually was extremely breathtaking.
Normally you don't find many lists in a leisure book, something but in this one you have already encountered one. And that was just in the beginning. There is more to come.....
